page.title: 01MOORLAND SOUTH OF GOATHLAND
page.content: Predominantly high heather covered moorland devoted to sheep farming and grouse shooting. West Beck runs north through the area creating a valley that can be used for farming. Predominantly sheep and cattle grazing but in the northern part of the valley towards Goathland quite a lot of woodland, deciduous and coniferous plantation. Below the moorland there is a scattering of farms and the north contains part of the spread out village of Goathland, mostly residential houses and a couple of hotels. Because the area is very picturesque (especially Goathland) it is much visited by tourists, some of whom stay in the area in hotels or youth hostel. Also a popular area with walks because of the unspoilt woodland and moorland and also its accessibility and facilities in
